Name: IIS AppPool - Create
Description: Creates or Reconfigures an IIS Application Pool

Parameters.Name: AppPoolName
Parameters.Label: Application pool name
Parameters.HelpText: The name of the application pool that the application will run under.

Parameters.Name: AppPoolIdentityType
Parameters.Label: Identity Type
Parameters.HelpText: The type of identity that the application pool will be using.

DisplaySettings.Octopus.SelectOptions:
0|Local System
1|Local Service
2|Network Service
3|Specific User...
4|Application Pool Identity

Parameters.Name: AppPoolIdentityUser
Parameters.Label: Specific User Name
Parameters.HelpText: _(Specific User)_ The user name to use with the application pool identity.

Parameters.Name: AppPoolIdentityPassword
Parameters.Label: Specific User Password
Parameters.HelpText: _(Specific User)_ The password for the specific user to use with the application pool identity.

Parameters.Name: AppPoolLoadUserProfile
Parameters.Label: Load User Profile
Parameters.HelpText: This setting specifies whether IIS loads the user profile for an application pool identity.

Parameters.Name: AppPoolEnable32BitAppOnWin64
Parameters.Label: Enable 32-Bit Applications
Parameters.HelpText: Allows the application pool to run 32-bit applications when running on 64-bit windows.

Parameters.Name: AppPoolAutoStart
Parameters.Label: Start Automatically
Parameters.HelpText: Automatically start the application pool when the application pool is created or whenever IIS is started.

Parameters.Name: AppPoolManagedRuntimeVersion
Parameters.Label: Managed Runtime Version
Parameters.HelpText: Specifies the CLR version to be used by the application pool.

DisplaySettings.Octopus.SelectOptions:
v1.1|CLR v1.1 (.NET 1.0, 1.1)
v2.0|CLR v2.0 (.NET 2.0, 3.0, 3.5)
v4.0|CLR v4.0 (.NET 4.0, 4.5, 4.6)
No Managed Code|No Managed Code (ASP.NET Core)

Parameters.Name: AppPoolManagedPipelineMode
Parameters.Label: Managed Pipeline Mode
Parameters.HelpText: Specifies the request-processing mode that is used to process requests for managed content.

Parameters.Name: AppPoolIdleTimeoutMinutes
Parameters.Label: Process Idle Timeout
Parameters.HelpText: Amount of time (in minutes) a worker process will remain idle before it shuts down. A value of 0 means the process does not shut down after an idle timeout.

Parameters.Name: AppPoolMaxProcesses
Parameters.Label: Maximum Worker Processes
Parameters.HelpText: Maximum number of worker processes permitted to service requests for the application pool.

Parameters.Name: AppPoolRegularTimeInterval
Parameters.Label: Regular Time Interval
Parameters.HelpText: Period of time (in minutes) after which an application pool will recycle. A value of 0 means the application pool does not recycle on a regular interval.

Parameters.Name: AppPoolPeriodicRecycleTime
Parameters.Label: Application pool periodic recycle time
Parameters.HelpText: A specific local time, in minutes after midnight, when the application pool is recycled. Separate multiple times by using a ,\n\nExample: \"00:30:00\" for half an hour past midnight. or \"06:00:00\" for midnight and 6 am.

Parameters.Name: AppPoolQueueLength
Parameters.Label: Queue Length
Parameters.HelpText: Maximum number of requests that HTTP.sys will queue for the application pool. When the queue is full, new requests receive a 504 "Service Unavailable" response.

Parameters.Name: AppPoolStartMode
Parameters.Label: Start Mode
Parameters.HelpText: Specifies whether the application pool should run in On Demand Mode or Always Running Mode.

Parameters.Name: AppPoolCpuLimit
Parameters.Label: CPU Limit (percent)
Parameters.HelpText:
Configures the maximum percentage of CPU time (in percent) that the worker processes in an application pool are allowed to consume over a period of time as indicated by the resetInterval attribute. If the limit set by the limit attribute is exceeded, an event is written to the event log and an optional set of events can be triggered. These optional events are determined by the action attribute.

The default value is 0, which disables CPU limiting.

Parameters.Name: AppPoolCpuLimitAction
Parameters.Label: CPU Limit Action
Parameters.HelpText:
Configures the action that IIS takes when a worker process exceeds its configured CPU limit. The action attribute is configured on a per-application pool basis.

The action attribute can be one of the following possible values. The default value is NoAction.
